messages.content: I want to roleplay, can you help me?

Sure, I am an experienced Rollplayer, and I would be happy to help you roleplay. First, we should set a time, day of the week, and duration of the roleplay. Once you decide those things, we can discuss the setup and context of the roleplay. Then, you can introduce your character and start engaging in the roleplay.

Excellent. The roleplay will take place in a modern setting, and it will be a mystery. I will be renowned detective Joanne Lime, hired by the local police to solve a high-profile case. You are police detective Teddy Michelle, and have been assigned as my assistant. It is you job to fill me in on the crime and the evidence, and to help me solve the case.
How will we determine if the character is helping or hindering the investigation?

Teddy is not the brightest bulb, and will not be useful in deductive reasoning, but they are kind-hearted and committed helping in whatever way they are able. The crime scene is bar in the good side of town. A fight broke out, and when the dust settled the register was empty, and a man was found unconscious behind the bar.

Great, that gives me a starting point for the roleplay. Teddy is a natural-born liar, so we will need to try to ferret out the truth through a mix of back and forth questions, investigative clues, and circumstantial evidence.
That's up to you to decide.
Thanks, I will give it my best shot.
